result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rockey L Hawthorne

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Carter on 10/31/2022.

11:09 AM Defendant Rockey L Hawthorne not in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Rockey L Hawthorne. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense does not know why the Defendant does not appear today, as he had contact with him last week. 

Court had previously stayed a capias. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.  Court orders same.
EXT=CODE 3
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:21 AM Defendant Rockey L Hawthorne not in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Rockey L Hawthorne. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Atty Tapia has not had recent contact with the Defendant (since 08/03/2022), and requests a stayed capias.  
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 

Court will issue a capias, but stay it until the next hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am. **Rescheduled due to a conflict with the Court's Calendar.**

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Rockey L Hawthorne in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   

Defense has discovery and an offer.
  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:45 AM Defendant Rockey L Hawthorne in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia and SPD Intern Cuco Longloria.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

10:33 AM Defendant Rockey L Hawthorne in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia and SPD Intern Cuco Longloria.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count 2.
Mr. Longloria presents arguments and requests the Court to dismiss count 2.
ADA Sitzberger presents arguments and requests the Court to deny the Defendant's motion.
Mr. Longloria presents additional arugments.
The Court places its findings on the record.
The Court denies the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count 2.
De Novo rights given.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to dismiss count 2
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any CBD products, any vaping products, controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:24 PM Defendant Rockey L Hawthorne in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.
